instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 2018 15 inch 55V on backlight output
threads.message:
Hello guys 

have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 2018 15 inch with 55V on backlight output but has no backlight . I have tried with a know good screen , and a different screen cable but no changes , please help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 2018 15 inch 55V on backlight output
threads.message:
Check continuity between <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> and J8500.
55V means there is broken conectivity for LED strips.
Bad connector, video cable, or LCD assembly.
Is there an intermediate short cable between MLB an LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 2018 15 inch 55V on backlight output
threads.message: Thanks for your response... I replaced a different Lcd assembly, the connector looks great, I also replaced the video cable , but no changes . ?Is there an intermediate short cable between MLB an LCD assembly?? I don?t understand what you mean by this , are you referring to the display flex cable that connects to the main board and screen assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 2018 15 inch 55V on backlight output
threads.message:
Yes, you have to check all connections between MLB and LCD panel.
You have no continuity for LED strips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 2018 15 inch 55V on backlight output
threads.message: since I have already tested a video cable and another screen , I will now check  continuity on  <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> and j8500
